department.en: Interdisciplinary Program of Earth System Science

goal.ch: 這是一門展示累積多年的斷層研究的課程，而且將說明當前被廣泛接受的斷層地質概念與研究。這門課有兩個重點。第一，全面檢視斷層的各個面向，並將著重在斷層作用與伴隨之微構造。第二，這門課展示多學科對斷層的研究。這門課使用教科書與科學文章為教材讓學生熟悉斷層地質學。因此，每周學生將需要研讀書籍與文章，並且分享與討論該閱讀材料之內容。
goal.en: This course is the accumulation of many years of research on fault and represents the widely accepted concept of the state of the art in fault-zone geology. Two aims are addressed in this course. First, a holistic view on all facets of fault, with a focus on faulting processes and the associated textures. Second, this course presents a multidisciplinary approach that unites the different sub-disciplines that are concerned with faults. This course uses text-books and research article to make student familiar with fault-zone geology. Therefore, all students are required to read text books and articles and share their point of view on the studied materials every week.

outline.ch:
-Week 1: introduction
Week 2: earthquake engine (fault)
Week 3: understanding faults: chapter 2: fault mechanics and earthquakes
Week 4: understanding faults: chapter 5: faulting in the laboratory
Week 5: understanding faults: chapter 8: fault sealing
Week 6: fault-related paper: Fossen 2017: shear zones
Week 7: fault-related paper: Faulkner 2010: fault development
Week 8: fault-related paper: Choi 2016: fault damage zone
Week 9: fault-related paper: Anders 2014: microfractures
Week 10: fault-related paper: Brodsky 2019: the state of stress
Week 11: fault-related paper: Niemeijer 2012: earthquake physics
Week 12: fault-related paper: Di Toro 2011: fault lubrication
Week 13: fault-related paper: Rowe 2015: faults preserve records?
Week 14: fault-related paper: Piane 2017: carbonate fault rock
Week 15: fault-related paper: Cao 2019: graphitic materials in fault zones
Week 16: fault-related paper: Kuo 2014, 2017, 2018: graphitization in the active fault
Week 17: fault-related paper: Kuo 2009, 2011, 2014, 2015: frictional heating on clay gouge
Week 18: fault-related paper: Bebout 2016: fluid and mass transfer
實際內容依課堂公告說明

gradMethod.ch: 總成績，將是所有週數報告所得分數之平均分數，沒有期中考與期末考。
gradMethod.en: The final score will be an on-average value of score obtained from each-week presentation. No mid-or final term.
